column5: row identifie
constraint name (not necessarily unique!
the oid of the namespace that contains this constrain
c = check constraint, f = foreign key constraint, p = primary key constraint, u = unique constraint, t = constraint trigger, x = exclusion constrain
is the constraint deferrable
is the constraint deferred by default
has the constraint been validated? currently, can only be false for foreign keys and check constraint
the table this constraint is on; 0 if not a table constrain
the domain this constraint is on; 0 if not a domain constrain
the index supporting this constraint, if it's a unique, primary key, foreign key, or exclusion constraint; else
the corresponding constraint in the parent partitioned table, if this is a constraint in a partition; else
if a foreign key, the referenced table; else
foreign key update action code: a = no action, r = restrict, c = cascade, n = set null, d = set defaul
foreign key deletion action code: a = no action, r = restrict, c = cascade, n = set null, d = set defaul
foreign key match type: f = full, p = partial, s = simpl
this constraint is defined locally for the relation. note that a constraint can be locally defined and inherited simultaneously
the number of direct inheritance ancestors this constraint has. a constraint with a nonzero number of ancestors cannot be dropped nor renamed
this constraint is defined locally for the relation. it is a non-inheritable constraint
if a table constraint (including foreign keys, but not constraint triggers), list of the constrained column
if a foreign key, list of the referenced column
if a foreign key, list of the equality operators for pk = fk comparison
if a foreign key, list of the equality operators for pk = pk comparison
if a foreign key, list of the equality operators for fk = fk comparison
if an exclusion constraint, list of the per-column exclusion operator
if a check constraint, an internal representation of the expression. (it's recommended to use pg_get_constraintdef() to extract the definition of a check constraint.
